scenarioDescription:
The MOA-2012-BLG-505L Exoplanetary System


Overview

MOA-2012-BLG-505L is a star with 0.1 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 23515.85 light years away from the solar system.

MOA-2012-BLG-505L is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the MOA-2012-BLG-505L system


MOA-2012-BLG-505L b

MOA-2012-BLG-505L b was discovered by the MOA observatory, in 2017-07, using the microlensing method. Its semi-major axis is 0.90 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of MOA-2012-BLG-505L b is 6.710 times the mass of Earth. The radius of MOA-2012-BLG-505L b is 2.480 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, MOA-2012-BLG-505L b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system MOA-2012-BLG-505L, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the MOA.
name: MOA-2012-BLG-505L - System With 1 Exoplanet
